body:
So first of all the behavior is controlled by the [`quarkus.websockets-next.client.unhandled-failure-strategy`](https://quarkus.io/guides/websockets-next-reference#websocket-next-configuration-reference) config property. It defines the action taken when _no error handler_ can handle the failure. It's documented here: https://quarkus.io/guides/websockets-next-reference#error-handling.

> 1. error printed about exception happening when calling onMessage - why should that be hidden?

I don't remember the details but there were some requests to avoid excessive logging.

Maybe we should change the `close` strategy to close and log error instead? Or even introduce the `close_and_log` strategy and make it default? @cescoffier @geoand WDYT?

> 2. have client traffic logging include cause/reason on errors

That's doable but in this particular case you would just see `1011 - Internal server error`. We don't want to leak the info (such as NPE) to the server. Hm, but maybe we could in the dev mode...

> Maybe we should change the close strategy to close and log error instead? Or even introduce the close_and_log strategy and make it default? @cescoffier @geoand WDYT?

Sure, that sounds reasonable

Hm, I've just noticed that the RFC states _"Clients SHOULD NOT close the WebSocket connection arbitrarily."_. And also the [status codes](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6455#section-7.4.1) seem to be very server-centric. Which makes me wonder if the `quarkus.websockets-next.client.unhandled-failure-strategy`  should only permit `log` and `noop` strategies...

(I removed my previous comment - I thought it was server-side)

So, I agree with the spec for the client. In this case, we should not close the connection but instead handle the failure. The _log_ and _noop_ strategy makes sense. I think _log_ should be the default. 

We could imagine a _close_ strategy with a 1003 status. It should not be the default.

issue.title: WebSockets next: improve default strategies for unhandled failures
issue.body:
- introduce UnhandledFailureStrategy.LOG_AND_CLOSE
- WebSocketsClientRuntimeConfig#unhandledFailureStrategy - change the default value from "close" to "log"
- WebSocketsServerRuntimeConfig#unhandledFailureStrategy - change the default value from "close" to "log-and-close"
- resolves #42569
